column1: Nipple discharge is any fluid that comes out of the nipple area in your breast.

Here are some reasons for nipple discharge: - Pregnancy - Recent breastfeeding - Rubbing on the area from a bra or t-shirt - Injury to the breast - Infection - Inflammation and clogging of the breast ducts - Noncancerous pituitary tumors - Small growth in the breast that is usually not cancer - Severe underactive thyroid gland (hypothyroidism) - Fibrocystic breast (normal lumpiness in the breast) - Use of certain medicines - Use of certain herbs, such as anise and fennel - Widening of the milk ducts Sometimes, babies can have nipple discharge.
Cancers such as Paget's disease (a rare type of cancer involving the skin of the nipple) can also cause nipple discharge.
